sentences: See mõte oli tal õieti ammu peas olnud.
context: The Estonian word 'õieti' is an adverb with multiple meanings depending on context. It can mean 'actually' or 'really' when emphasizing reality (as in 'Mis ta sinust õieti tahab?' - What does he actually want from you?). It can also mean 'properly' or 'correctly' when referring to correctness ('Mõistke mind õieti!' - Understand me properly!). In some contexts, it functions as an intensifier meaning 'quite' or 'rather' ('Päike paistis juba õieti soojalt.' - The sun was already shining quite warmly). Additionally, it can mean 'in fact' when providing precise information ('See juhtus sügisel, õieti juba augustis.' - This happened in autumn, actually already in August).
